metadata.Title: CVE-2023-20592 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: Improper or unexpected behavior of the INVD instruction in some AMD CPUs may allow an attacker with a malicious hypervisor to affect cache line write-back behavior of the CPU leading to a potential loss of guest virtual machine (VM) memory integrity.

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Ruiyi Zhang, Lukas Gerlach, Daniel Weber, Lorenz Hetterich, Youheng Lue, Leon Trampert, Andreas Kogler and Michael Schwarz

notes.Note: alexmurray> The microcode revisions listed in the AMD advisory AMD-SB-3005 were contained in the upstream commit b250b32ab1d044953af2dc5e790819a7703b7ee6 - this was already provided to the various Ubuntu releases in USN-6319-1 for CVE-2023-20569, as such they are not affected by this CVE.

criterions.comment: amd64-microcode: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
